pinHelp.title: Secure your PIN code
pinHelp.intro: During the setup process you choose a PIN code.

rules.2: <0>Always</0> enter your PIN code out of sight.
rules.3: You can change your PIN code if needed.
rules.4: Three wrong PIN code entries in a row will reset the device.
rules.5: <0>Never</0> use an easy PIN code like 0000, 123456, or 55555555.
rules.6: <0>Never</0> share your PIN code with someone else. Not even with Ledger.
rules.7: <0>Never</0> use a PIN code you did not choose yourself.
rules.8: <0>Never</0> store your PIN code on a computer or phone.

recoverySeed.title1: How does a recovery phrase work?
recoverySeed.paragraph1: Your recovery phrase works like a unique master key. Your Ledger device uses it to calculate private keys for every crypto asset you own.
recoverySeed.paragraph2: To restore access to your crypto, any wallet can calculate the same private keys from your recovery phrase.
recoverySeed.title2: What happens if I lose access to my Nano?
recoverySeed.paragraph3: Don't worry and follow these steps:

points.2: Select ‚ÄúRestore recovery phrase on a new device‚Äù in the Ledger app
points.3: Enter your recovery phrase on your new device to restore access to your crypto.

whereToHide.title: Where should I keep my recovery phrase?

points.1: <0>NEVER</0> enter it on a computer, smartphone or any other device. Don't take a picture of it.
points.3: <0>ALWAYS</0> store it in a secure place, out of sight.
points.4: Ledger will never ask for your recovery phrase.
points.5: If any person or application asks for it, assume it is a scam!

beCareful.title: Please be careful
beCareful.descr: Make sure you follow the instructions on this app at every step of the process.

useLedgerSeeds.title: We recommend Ledger recovery phrases only
useLedgerSeeds.descr: Ledger cannot guarantee the security of external recovery phrases. We recommend setting up your Nano as a new device if your recovery phrase was not generated by a Ledger.

rules.1: Plan 30 minutes and take your time.
rules.2: Grab a pen to write with.
rules.3: Stay alone, and choose a safe and quiet environment.

turnOn.title: Turn on Nano
turnOn.descr: Connect your device to your computer with the USB cable.

browse.title: Browse
browse.descr: Learn how to interact with your device by reading the on-screen instructions.

select.title: Select ‚ÄúSet up as new device‚Äù
select.descr: Press both buttons simultaneously to validate the selection.

follow.title: Follow instructions
follow.descr: Come back here to follow instructions on your PIN code.

turnOn.title: Turn on Nano
turnOn.descr: Connect your device to your computer with the USB cable.

browse.title: Browse
browse.descr: Learn how to interact with your device by reading the on-screen instructions.

select.title: Select ‚ÄúEnter your recovery phrase‚Äù
select.descr: Press both buttons simultaneously to validate the selection.

follow.title: Follow instructions
follow.descr: Come back here to follow instructions on your PIN code.

pinCode.title: PIN code
pinCode.paragraph: Your PIN code is the first layer of security. It physically secures access to your private key and your Nano. Your PIN code must be 4 to 8 digits long.
pinCode.disclaimer: I understand that I must choose my PIN code myself and keep it private.

quizSuccess.title: Already a pro!
quizSuccess.paragraph:
You are ready to safely manage your crypto.

Only one quick step left!

quizFailure.title: You will soon become a pro...
quizFailure.paragraph:
Don‚Äôt worry, Ledger is here to guide you through your journey. You will soon feel extra comfortable about your crypto safety.

Only one quick step left!

setUp.title: Choose PIN code
setUp.descr: Press the left or right button to change digits. Press both buttons to validate a digit. Select <0></0> to confirm your PIN code. Select <1></1> to erase a digit.

confirm.title: Confirm PIN code
confirm.descr: Enter your PIN code again to confirm it.

existingRecoveryPhrase.title: Enter your recovery phrase
existingRecoveryPhrase.paragraph1: Your recovery phrase is the secret list of words that you backed up when you first set up your wallet.
existingRecoveryPhrase.paragraph2: Ledger does not keep a copy of your recovery phrase.
existingRecoveryPhrase.disclaimer: I understand that if I lose my recovery phrase, I will not be able to access my crypto in case I lose access to my Nano.

warning.title: Do not use a recovery phrase that you have not generated yourself.
warning.desc: Your Ledger hardware wallet‚Äôs pin code and recovery phrase should be initialized by you and only you. If you have received a device with a pre-existing seed word or an already initialized pin code do not use the product and contact our customer support.

takeYourRecoverySheet.title: Take your recovery sheet
takeYourRecoverySheet.descr: Grab a blank Recovery sheet, included with your Nano. Please reach out to Ledger Support if the Recovery sheet did not come blank.

writeDownWords.title: Write down 24 words
writeDownWords.descr:
Write Word #1 displayed on your Nano in position 1 of your Recovery sheet. Then press right on your Nano to display Word #2 and write it down in position 2.

Repeat the process for all words while carefully respecting the order and spelling. Press left on your Nano to check for any mistakes.

newRecoveryPhrase.title: Recovery phrase
newRecoveryPhrase.paragraph1: Your recovery phrase is a secret list of 24 words that backs up your private keys.
newRecoveryPhrase.paragraph2: Your Nano generates a unique recovery phrase. Ledger does not keep a copy of it.
newRecoveryPhrase.disclaimer: I understand that if I lose this recovery phrase, I will not be able to access my crypto in case I lose access to my Nano.

selectLength.title: Select recovery phrase length
selectLength.descr: Your recovery phrases can have 12, 18 or 24 words. You must enter all words to access your crypto.

enterWord.title: Enter Word #1...
enterWord.descr: Enter the first letters of Word #1 by selecting them with the right or left button. Press both buttons to validate each letter.

validateWord.title: Validate Word #1...
validateWord.descr: Choose Word #1 from the suggestions. Press both buttons to validate.

reEnterWord.title: Confirm your recovery phrase
reEnterWord.descr: Scroll through the words until you find Word #1 by pressing the right button. Validate by pressing both buttons.

success.title: All good!
success.desc: Your Ledger {{deviceName}} is genuine and ready to use with Ledger Live

hideRecoveryPhrase.title: Hide your recovery phrase
hideRecoveryPhrase.paragraph: Your recovery phrase is your last chance to access your crypto if you cannot use your Nano. You must keep it in a safe place.
hideRecoveryPhrase.keepItOffline: Enter these words on a hardware wallet only, not on computers or smartphones.
hideRecoveryPhrase.neverShowToAnyone: Never share your 24 words with anyone, not even with Ledger.

pairMyNano.title: Genuine check
pairMyNano.paragraph: We'll verify whether your Nano is genuine. This should be quick and easy!

accessYourCoins.title: Access your crypto
accessYourCoins.description: Your crypto assets are stored on the blockchain. You need a private key to access and manage them.

ownYourPrivateKey.title: Own your private key
ownYourPrivateKey.description: Your private key is stored within your Nano. You must be the only one to own it to be in control of your money.

stayOffline.title: Stay offline
stayOffline.description: Your Nano works as a "cold storage" wallet. This means that it never exposes your private key online, even when using the app.

validateTransactions.title: Validate transactions
validateTransactions.description: Ledger Live allows you to buy, sell, manage, exchange and earn crypto while remaining protected. You will validate every crypto transaction with your Nano.

setUpNanoWallet.title: Let‚Äôs set up your Nano!
setUpNanoWallet.description: We'll start by setting up your Nano security.

quizz.heading: Quiz
quizz.title: Now game on!
quizz.descr: Answer 3 simple questions to avoid common misconceptions about your hardware wallet.

1.text: As a Ledger user, my crypto is stored:

success.title: Congrats!
success.text: Your crypto is always stored on the blockchain. Your hardware wallet only holds your private key, which gives you access to your crypto.

fail.title: Incorrect!
fail.text: Your crypto is always stored on the blockchain. Your hardware wallet only holds your private key, which gives you access to your crypto.

2.text: If my recovery phrase is no longer secure or private...

answers.1: No problem, Ledger can send me a copy
answers.2: My crypto is no longer safe and I need to transfer them to a secure place

success.title: Congrats!
success.text:
Anyone who knows your recovery phrase can steal your crypto assets. 
If you lose it, you must quickly transfer your crypto to a secure place.

fail.title: Incorrect!
fail.text:
Anyone who knows your recovery phrase can steal your crypto assets. 
If you lose it, you must quickly transfer your crypto to a secure place.

3.text: When I connect my Nano to the Ledger app, my private key is...

success.title: Congrats!
success.text: Your private key always remains offline in your hardware wallet. Even when connected to your Nano, the Ledger app cannot access your private key. You must physically authorize every transaction on your device.

fail.title: Incorrect!
fail.text: Your private key always remains offline in your hardware wallet. Even when connected to your Nano, the Ledger app cannot access your private key. You must physically authorize every transaction on your device.
